newsitem.title: USA: Texas carrier files complaint vs Southwestern Bell.
newsitem.headline: Texas carrier files complaint vs Southwestern Bell.

text.p: Preferred Carrier Services Inc said Friday it has filed a complaint with the Federal Communications Commission and the Texas Public Utility Commission against SBC Communications Inc's Southwestern Bell.

The company, a competitive local exchange carrier, said the complaint alleges Southwestern Bell used confidential customer information for marketing purposes in violation of the Telecommunications Act of 1996.
A SBC Communications spokesman said the company was not immediately aware of the complaint and had no immediate comment.
Preferred Carrier said a marketing firm hired by Southwestern Bell is calling Preferred Carrier customers to poll them about why they are no longer Southwestern Bell customers.
Preferred Carrier itself received one such call from the marketing firm, it said.

"A thinly disguised effort to utilize a telemarketing firm to obtain market research information can easily be disruptive to the customer relationship with the new competitive exchange carrier," Preferred Carrier chief executive Nelson Thibodeaux said in a written statement.
Preferred Carrier is a long distance carrier in 49 states and holds local exchange authority in 24 states, it said.
